Context:
Program Name: Architectural Technician
Code: T132
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Method of Study: Full-time
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,261.00 *
International Tuition: $18,298.00 **
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Availability: Fall 2024 (Open), Winter 2025 (Open), Spring 2025 (Not Available)
Related Programs: Architectural Technology (T109), Interior Design (T178), Civil Engineering Technology (T164)

* Domestic students only for the $40,000 scholarship.

Program Overview: A 2-year Architectural Technician diploma program that prepares students to work alongside architects, designers, contractors, and builders in designing and developing buildings using sustainable building practices and constructability techniques. Students will learn in state-of-the-art architectural studios with up-to-date equipment and software, focusing on architectural drawing, technical design skills, sustainable building design, construction materials, teamwork, project-based learning, and various courses covering 2D and 3D computer-aided drafting, design, rendering, and modeling, design and development drawings, construction drawings, architectural presentation, as well as concepts of building science, building systems, building codes, and construction law.

[*] Domestic students are eligible for a $40,000 scholarship.
[**] Tuition fees for international students.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Architectural Technician Program T132 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about a program offered at a college in the field of Architectural Technology. Students enrolled in this program are required to complete semester 2 in the summer of the same year to continue into semester 3 in the fall.

Career opportunities for graduates include, but are not limited to: project coordinator, technical representative for building/equipment suppliers, production of computer-aided technical drawings and modelling, developer, property manager, technician with builders/developers, and customer service agent with builders/developers.

The program consists of four semesters, each containing several required courses:

Semester 1: ARCH 1005 - Architectural Technology & Studio 1, ARCH 1014 - Canadian Industry Practices, ARCH 1048 - Structural Systems 1, ARCH 1050 - Visual Communications 1, ARCH 1060 - Design Fundamentals, CADE 1012 - CAD Drawing 1, COMM 2000 - Communicating Across Contexts, MATH 1139 - Mathematics for Arch/IDT 1, and an elective course (GNED).

Semester 2: ARCH 1006 - Architectural Technology & Studio 2, ARCH 1013 - Building Code & Regulations 1, ARCH 1109 - Building Systems – Mechanical and Electrical, ARCH 1164 - Fundamentals of Building Science, CADE 1014 - CAD Drawing 2, MATH 1149 - Mathematics for Arch/IDT 2, and a General Education Elective.

Semester 3: ARCH 1058 - Structural Systems 2, ARCH 2004 - Architectural Technology & Studio 3, ARCH 2007 - Building Code & Regulations 2, ARCH 2009 - Practice Management, ARCH 2010 - History of Architecture and Building Technologies, CADE 2001 - Digital Practices for Architecture 1, COMM 1113 - Professional Communications for Building Technologies, and a General Education Elective.

Semester 4: ARCH 2005 - Architectural Technology & Studio 4, ARCH 2033 - Visual Communications 2, ARCH 2034 - Structural Systems 3, ARCH 2035 - Materials, Methods and Components 2, ARCH 3017 - Building Code and Regulations 3, ARCH 3037 - Fundamentals of Project Cost Estimating, CADE 3001 - Digital Practices for Architecture 2.

No specific year or email information is mentioned in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Architectural Technician Program T132 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Communicate with clients, contractors, other building professionals and approval authorities.
- Assist in the preparation, reading and interpretation of drawings and graphical representations used in building projects.
- Read and assist in the preparation of specifications and project documents.
- Assist in the preparation of estimates of time, costs and quantity.
- Assist in solving technical problems related to building projects through the application of principles of building science and mathematics.
- Collaborate with members of the building team.
- Assist in the development of architectural designs.
- Review and assist in the preparation of site-planning documents.
- Comply with legal and ethical requirements of an architectural technician.
- Assist in assessment of buildings related to repurposing and renovation projects.
- Ensure personal safety in the workplace.
- Identify sustainable design and building practices.
- Use current and emerging technology to support building projects.
- Assist in administration of construction phase of building projects.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,261.00 *
- International Tuition: $18,298.00 **

* For programs starting in Fall 2023
** For programs starting in Fall 2024

Note: Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates. Does not include books which are to be purchased separately.

Context:
The text provides information on various aspects of applying to George Brown College. Here are some factual information extracted from the text:

1. Fees: The fees for domestic and international students are subject to change without notice, and do not include books which should be purchased separately. International students can refer to the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.
2. Financial Assistance: The program is approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.
3. Admission Requirements: Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, English 12 (C or U), Math 11 or 12 (M or U), or mature student status and pass the Admissions Assessment for English and Math. George Brown College has a policy of ensuring that applicants will succeed in their program of choice, meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program.
4. Course Exemptions: Applicants can check the Transfer Guide for information on course exemptions from college or university credits.
5. Application Process: Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
6. Contact Information: The School of Architectural Studies can be contacted at 416-415-5000, ext. 4365 or email [architecturalstudies@georgebrown.ca](mailto:architecturalstudies@georgebrown.ca). Their office hours are 8 a.m. – 4 p.m., room D303. For general information, contact the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002. International students can also contact a recruitment representative specialized by country of origin through the International Contact page.

Context: To attend an on-campus information session, visitors can sign up and meet the instructors and staff, ask questions, and experience George Brown College classrooms. Interested individuals can explore related programs such as Architectural Technology (T109), Interior Design (T178), and Civil Engineering Technology (T164). Visitors can also book a campus tour or sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process. The contact form requires the visitor's first name, last name, email address, whether they are domestic or international students, and their country of origin. They must have JavaScript enabled to use the form and agree to receive email communications from George Brown College.
